definition: variant of 惡心|恶心[e3 xin1]
to have a mean-looking face but a heart of gold (idiom)

sentences.english: Hate does not feel disgusting of war.
sentences.chinese: 讨厌却不能撕破脸的感觉真恶心。

sentences.english: Do not use when abdominal pain, nausea or vomiting are present.
sentences.chinese: 当腹部感到疼痛时，恶心，呕吐时请勿使用。

sentences.english: Often appear these days giddy and disgusting, this kind of symptom is discontinuity .
sentences.chinese: 最近几天老是出现头晕恶心，这种症状是间断性的。

sentences.english: Nausea surged in him and he retched violently.
sentences.chinese: 他突然觉得恶心，猛烈地干呕起来。

sentences.english: The raw fish disgusted me , so I left the table.
sentences.chinese: 生鱼让我感到恶心，所以我离开了餐桌。

sentences.english: And it is, I take it, disgusting.
Seeing roaches swarm is absolutely disgusting, so be prepared.
sentences.chinese: 看小强成群的爬肯定很恶心，所以要有心理准备。

sentences.english: As always, the gin made him shudder and even retch slightly.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一样，他感到一阵哆嗦，甚至有些恶心。

sentences.english: B6 vitamins can relieve some of your nausea.
sentences.chinese: 维生素B6可以缓解你的恶心症状。

sentences.english: The mixture of his sweat and deodorant smells gross.
sentences.chinese: 他的汗和体香剂混合在一起的味道闻起来真恶心。

sentences.english: Opioid premedication may contribute to the incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting.
sentences.chinese: 预给阿片类药物可以减轻术后发生的恶心呕吐。

sentences.english: To euthanize unwanted pets has made his wife sick to her stomach.
sentences.chinese: 对不要的宠物进行安乐死，令他老婆很恶心。

sentences.english: It is not yucky , Billy. Eat it .
I feel sick of somebodys who always with their tongue in their cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她让我恶心，说话口气总是很假。

sentences.english: No longer will they follow the stubbornness of their evil hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他们必不再随从自己顽梗的恶心行事。

definition: to feel sick/to feel nauseous/to feel disgusted
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to feel agitated/to be troubled/to be annoyed/an upset or distraction
vertigo/dizziness/fainting/feeling of swaying, head spinning, lack of balance or floating (e.g. from a stroke)/Taiwan pr. [xuan4 yun1]
